definition: to give up/to abandon/to give alms

sentences.english: Ye have heard that it hath been said, Thou shalt love thy neighbour, and hate thine enemy.
sentences.chinese: 你们听见有话说，当爱你的邻舍，恨你的仇敌。

sentences.english: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.
sentences.chinese: 你的脚要少进邻舍的家，恐怕他厌烦你，恨恶你。

sentences.english: One who gives false witness against his neighbour is a hammer and a sword and a sharp arrow.
sentences.chinese: 作假见证陷害邻舍的，就是大槌，是利刀，是快箭。

sentences.english: It means spending time helping a neighbor. It means leaving room for people to make mistakes.
sentences.chinese: 好客就是花时间帮助邻舍，也是宽待那些犯错的人。

sentences.english: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.
sentences.chinese: 他们像喂饱的马到处乱跑，各向他邻舍的妻发嘶声。

sentences.english: Then he said, Go, borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours, even empty vessels; borrow not a few.
sentences.chinese: 以利沙说，你去，向你众邻舍借空器皿，不要少借。

sentences.english: Elisha said, 'Go around and ask all your neighbors for empty jars. Don't ask for just a few.
sentences.chinese: 以利沙说，你去，向你众邻舍借空器皿，不要少借。

sentences.english: It can make an important difference in families, neighborhoods, workplaces and nations.
sentences.chinese: 它可以让家庭，邻舍，工作场所和国家变得有所不同。

sentences.english: A man void of understanding striketh hands, and becometh surety in the presence of his friend.
sentences.chinese: 在邻舍面前击掌作保，乃是无知的人。

sentences.english: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;
sentences.chinese: 我若受迷惑，向妇人起淫念，在邻舍的门外蹲伏。

sentences.english: Like a club or a sword or a sharp arrow is the man who gives false testimony against his neighbor.
sentences.chinese: 作假见证陷害邻舍的，就是大磓，是利刀，是快箭。

sentences.english: Whoever flatters his neighbor is spreading a net for his feet.
sentences.chinese: 谄媚邻舍的，就是设网罗绊他的脚。

sentences.english: The wicked man craves evil; his neighbor gets no mercy from him.
sentences.chinese: 恶人的心，乐人受祸，他眼并不怜悯邻舍。

sentences.english: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour [is] a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.
sentences.chinese: 作假见证陷害邻舍的，就是大槌，是利刀，是快箭。

sentences.english: Seldom set foot in your neighbor's house- too much of you, and he will hate you.
sentences.chinese: 你的脚要少进邻舍的家，恐怕他厌烦你，恨恶你。

sentences.english: Do not plan harm against your neighbor whom lives trustingly beside you.
sentences.chinese: 你得邻舍既在你附近安居，你不可设计害他。

definition: neighbors/next-door neighbors/related work units/colleagues doing related work
(third person pronoun for a divine being)
Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
